title: EnglishPod 初级 英文播客 0085

segments.en: Hello, English learners.
Welcome back to EnglishPod.
My name is Marco.
And I'm Erika.
And today we're bringing you another lesson on our sports series.
segments.cn: 今天我们将为您带来体育系列的另一课。

segments.en: We're talking about baseball today.
Baseball, the American national pastime.
Is it?
Yes, it is.
Okay.
So we're going to be looking at this interesting sport that is played mainly in the Caribbean and, well, it's actually very popular in the United States and Japan.
segments.cn: 所以我们将看看这种主要在加勒比地区进行的有趣运动，实际上在美国和日本也非常受欢迎。

segments.en: That's right.
Korea.
Yep.
So we're not only going to learn a bunch of baseball language, but we're also going to see how baseball has a big influence on English in general.
segments.cn: 所以我们不仅会学习很多棒球术语，还会看到棒球对英语的重大影响。

segments.en: That's right.
So we're going to learn a lot of great things today.
segments.cn: 今天我们将学习很多精彩的内容。

segments.en: So why don't we start and listen to our dialogue.
segments.cn: 那么我们开始听对话吧。

segments.en: Hello, baseball fans, and welcome back to today's game.
segments.cn: 你好，棒球迷，欢迎回到今天的比赛。

segments.en: My name is Rick Fields.
And of course, I am here once again with a man that seals the deal, Bob Copeland.
segments.cn: 当然，我再次和达成交易的男人Bob Copeland在一起。

segments.en: It's a beautiful day to see two world-class teams face each other and fight for their right to be called champions.
segments.cn: 今天是个美丽的日子，看到两支世界级球队对决，争夺冠军的称号。

segments.en: Well, the national anthem has just been sung and the umpire has started the game.
segments.cn: 好吧，国歌刚刚唱完，裁判开始了比赛。

segments.en: It's time to play ball.
Roger Vargas is up at bat.
Pitcher winds up and strike one.
Very nice curve ball by the pitcher.
The catcher gives him the sign.
He winds up and Vargas gets a line drive.
segments.cn: 他准备好了，Vargas击出了一记平飞球。

segments.en: The players are scrambling to get the ball.
Vargas gets to first base and he's still going.
The outfielder throws it to second.
Vargas slides.
He's safe.
Great play.
We have a runner on third and up at bat is Brian Okami.
segments.cn: 我们有一个跑者在三垒，打击的是Brian Okami。

segments.en: There's the pitch.
He hits it.
It's going, going.
That ball is gone.
Home run by Okami.
That puts this team ahead by two as we are at the bottom of the fifth inning here at Ritchie Stadium.
segments.cn: 这让这支球队领先两分，现在是第五局底部，在Ritchie体育场。

segments.en: All right, well, a pretty exciting game there at Ritchie Stadium.
segments.cn: 好吧，Ritchie体育场的比赛相当激动人心。

segments.en: Exactly.
And we have some interesting players, Roger Vargas and Brian Okami.
segments.cn: 我们有一些有趣的球员，Roger Vargas和Brian Okami。

segments.en: All right, so, well, we saw some great words and, well, it's time for us to take a look at them now in Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们看到了一些很棒的词，现在是时候在语言收获中看看它们了。

segments.en: Language Takeaway.
Okay, we're going to look at some common sports and baseball words here.
segments.cn: 好的，我们将看看一些常见的体育和棒球词汇。

segments.en: Now, the first phrase, we'll hear this almost at any sort of international sports event, right?
segments.cn: 首先的短语，我们几乎在任何国际体育赛事中都会听到，对吗？

segments.en: Exactly.
And it's the national anthem.
National anthem.
National anthem.
So, this is a song, right?
Exactly.
It's the song that you sing about your country.
segments.cn: 这是你为你的国家唱的歌。

segments.en: And many people confuse it, right?
Yeah, a lot of people might say national hymn.
segments.cn: 是的，很多人可能会说国歌。

segments.en: Okay, hymn.
Because in some languages it might be like a hymn, like literally translating.
segments.cn: 因为在某些语言中，它可能像赞美诗一样，字面翻译。

segments.en: Yeah.
But in English it's called the national anthem.
The national anthem.
All right, so, what about our next word?
segments.cn: 好吧，那么我们的下一个词呢？

segments.en: Well, we were talking about the pitcher.
Pitcher.
P-i-t-c-h-e-r.
The pitcher.
Pitcher.
Okay, and now this is one of the players on a baseball team and his job is to... To throw the ball.
segments.cn: 好的，这是一支棒球队的球员之一，他的工作是... 投球。

segments.en: To throw the ball really fast.
So that the guy can hit it with the Okay, so that's the pitcher.
segments.cn: 让击球手击中球。 好的，所以这就是投手。

segments.en: Now, the interesting thing is that the baseball commentator said the pitcher winds up.
segments.cn: 有趣的是，棒球评论员说投手准备好了。

segments.en: Wind up.
To wind up.
To wind up.
Okay, well, let me paint you a picture.
Okay.
So, imagine a clock and you're turning, turning, and turning the clock to wind it up, to get it ready to go.
segments.cn: 所以，想象一个时钟，你在转动，转动，转动时钟来上弦，让它准备好。

segments.en: To make it work.
Exactly.
So, imagine the pitcher doing the same sort of thing.
segments.cn: 所以，想象投手做同样的事情。

segments.en: Bringing his arm back behind him, getting ready to throw the ball.
segments.cn: 把手臂向后摆，准备投球。

segments.en: Okay, so that is to wind up.
Very good.
So, you can use this word not only in baseball, but for other things that require you to do the section.
segments.cn: 所以，你可以在棒球中使用这个词，也可以用于其他需要你做这个动作的事情。

segments.en: Right, to turn something and get it ready to have lots of power.
segments.cn: 对，转动某物并准备好以获得强大的力量。

segments.en: Like some toys or maybe like a music box.
Okay, wind up.
What about our next phrase?
Well, Roger Vargas hit a line drive.
segments.cn: 好吧，Roger Vargas击出了一记平飞球。

segments.en: Line drive?
Line drive.
Okay, so what is a line drive?
Well, it's a term from baseball.
segments.cn: 这是棒球中的一个术语。

segments.en: And when you hit a line drive, you hit the ball sort of low on towards the ground and it travels along the outside of the field.
segments.cn: 当你击出平飞球时，你将球击得相对低，朝向地面，并沿着场外移动。

segments.en: Right, so the ball basically travels along the foul line.
segments.cn: 对，所以球基本上沿着界外线移动。

segments.en: That white line.
The white line.
Exactly.
Very good.
So, that's a line drive.
And so, the players on the field were scrambling to get the ball.
segments.cn: 所以，场上的球员们在争抢球。

segments.en: Scrambling.
Scrambling.
Now, we know scrambled eggs from one of our lessons.
segments.cn: 现在，我们知道“炒鸡蛋”这个词来自我们的某一课。

segments.en: Yes, but the verb to scramble means to move quickly in a disorganized way to do something.
segments.cn: 是的，但动词“scramble”意味着快速而无序地移动去做某事。

segments.en: Okay, so the players are moving very fast trying to get the ball, but they're not doing it very well.
segments.cn: 好的，所以球员们在快速移动，试图拿到球，但他们做得并不好。

segments.en: Right, and you can use this in other ways, right?
segments.cn: 对，你可以用这个词在其他方面，对吧？

segments.en: Not just in baseball.
Right, for example, we can say the people are scrambling to buy their tickets for the concert.
segments.cn: 对，例如，我们可以说人们在争抢买音乐会的票。

segments.en: Yeah, or I'm going on vacation tomorrow and I'm scrambling to get everything ready.
segments.cn: 是的，或者我明天要去度假，我正在忙着准备一切。

segments.en: Exactly.
It's a very good term that you can use also in your daily life.
segments.cn: 这是一个非常好的术语，你也可以在日常生活中使用。

segments.en: Exactly.
All right, and what about our last word for today on Language Takeaway?
segments.cn: 好的，今天我们最后一个词在语言收获中是什么？

segments.en: Well, they were in the fifth inning of the game.
segments.cn: 嗯，他们在比赛的第五局。

segments.en: Okay, so inning.
Inning.
Inning.
All right, this is another baseball term and it just means the period of play.
segments.cn: 好的，这是另一个棒球术语，意思是比赛的时间段。

segments.en: Okay, so we learned, for example, that in soccer you have two halves.
segments.cn: 好的，例如，我们了解到，在足球中有两个半场。

segments.en: Or in hockey you have three periods.
segments.cn: 或者在冰球中有三个阶段。

segments.en: All right, and in baseball you have nine innings.
Okay, great, so some interesting sports and baseball vocabulary.
segments.cn: 好的，很棒，一些有趣的体育和棒球词汇。

segments.en: Now, I think it will help us to hear this again slower, so let's listen to the dialogue.
segments.cn: 现在，我认为我们再慢慢听一遍会有帮助，所以让我们听听对话。

segments.en: Hello, baseball fans, and welcome back to today's game.
segments.cn: 你好，棒球迷，欢迎回到今天的比赛。

segments.en: My name is Rick Fields and, of course, I am here once again with the man that seals the deal, Bob Copeland.
segments.cn: 我叫瑞克·菲尔兹，当然，我再次和那个达成交易的人，鲍勃·科普兰在一起。

segments.en: It's a beautiful day to see two world-class teams face each other and fight for their right to be called champions.
segments.cn: 今天是个美丽的日子，看到两支世界级的球队对决，争夺冠军的权利。

segments.en: Well, the national anthem has just been sung and the umpire has started the game.
segments.cn: 嗯，国歌刚刚唱完，裁判开始了比赛。

segments.en: It's time to play ball.
Roger Vargas is up at bat.
segments.cn: 罗杰·瓦尔加斯上场击球。

segments.en: The pitcher winds up and strike one.
A very nice curveball by the pitcher.
segments.cn: 投手投出了一个非常好的曲球。

segments.en: The catcher gives him the sign.
He winds up and Vargas gets a line drive.
segments.cn: 他准备好，瓦尔加斯击出了一记平飞球。

segments.en: The players are scrambling to get the ball.
Vargas gets to first base and he's still going.
segments.cn: 瓦尔加斯到达一垒，他还在继续前进。

segments.en: The outfielder throws it to second.
Vargas slides.
He's safe.
Great play.
We have a runner on third and up at bat is Brian Okami.
segments.cn: 我们在三垒有一个跑者，击球的是布莱恩·冈美。

segments.en: There's the pitch.
He hits it.
It's going, going.
That ball is gone.
Home run by Okami.
That puts this team ahead by two as we are at the bottom of the fifth inning here at Richie Stadium.
segments.cn: 这让这支球队领先两分，因为我们在里奇体育场的第五局底部。

segments.en: All right, so as we said, there are a lot of English terms that come from baseball, but we use them in business context or in your daily life, right?
segments.cn: 好的，正如我们所说，有很多英语术语来自棒球，但我们在商业环境或日常生活中使用它们，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, why don't we look at those now in fluency builder.
segments.cn: 是的，为什么我们现在不看看这些流利构建者。

segments.en: Fluency builder.
All right, so the first phrase that we have is up to bat.
segments.cn: 好的，我们有的第一个短语是“上场击球”。

segments.en: Up to bat.
Up to bat.
So literally in this dialogue, it means the guy is standing on home plate, ready to hit the ball, right?
segments.cn: 所以在这个对话中，它字面意思是这个家伙站在本垒，准备击球，对吧？

segments.en: He has the bat and he's ready to hit it.
But what about in other contexts?
So for example, you can be at a meeting and maybe it's your turn to talk.
segments.cn: 例如，你可以在会议上，也许轮到你发言。

segments.en: So you're up to bat.
So yeah, exactly.
Your boss will say, OK, Erika, you're up to bat.
segments.cn: 你的老板会说，好的，埃里卡，你上场击球。

segments.en: OK, so it means sort of like it's your turn.
segments.cn: 好的，所以这意味着有点像轮到你了。

segments.en: It's your turn.
Yeah, very good.
All right, so that's another term that is used in baseball, but very commonly used in other circumstances.
segments.cn: 好的，这又是一个在棒球中使用的术语，但在其他情况下也很常用。

segments.en: So we also saw in the dialogue that Roger Vegas, he hit the ball, but he missed and that was strike one.
segments.cn: 所以我们在对话中也看到，罗杰·瓦尔加斯击中了球，但他错过了，那是第一球。

segments.en: Right, strike one.
So in baseball, you have three strikes, three tries, three tries before you're out.
segments.cn: 所以在棒球中，你有三次机会，三次尝试，三次机会，直到出局。

segments.en: Yes.
And so now the same thing happens in daily life.
segments.cn: 现在在日常生活中也发生同样的事情。

segments.en: So if someone says that was strike one, it means you made the first mistake.
segments.cn: 所以如果有人说那是第一球，意味着你犯了第一个错误。

segments.en: Yes.
And if you make two more, you will be fired, for example.
segments.cn: 如果你再犯两个错误，你就会被解雇，例如。

segments.en: Yeah.
Or maybe your parents will say, OK, that wasn't nice.
segments.cn: 或者也许你的父母会说，好的，那不太好。

segments.en: Strike one.
And then two more times and you'll have a timeout.
segments.cn: 然后再两次，你就会被罚站。

segments.en: Or you'll be grounded.
Yes.
OK, so that's also called a strike.
And the pitcher threw a curveball.
A curveball.
Curveball.
So OK, pretty clear.
A curveball is when you throw the ball and it sort of goes in a curve.
segments.cn: 曲球是当你投球时，球会以曲线的方式飞出。

segments.en: It doesn't go straight, right?
Exactly.
But how can this be used outside of baseball?
segments.cn: 但这在棒球之外如何使用呢？

segments.en: So you can say, oh, my boss threw me a curveball today.
segments.cn: 所以你可以说，哦，我的老板今天给了我一个曲球。

segments.en: So he gave you an unexpected problem or something that was difficult to handle.
segments.cn: 所以他给了你一个意想不到的问题或难以处理的事情。

segments.en: OK, this one is pretty interesting.
I'd like to hear a few more examples.
Example one.
My boss threw me a curveball today, so I have to stay and work late.
segments.cn: 我今天的老板给了我一个曲球，所以我得留下来加班。

segments.en: Example two.
It was a huge curveball when she asked me how many kids I wanted to have.
segments.cn: 当她问我想要几个孩子时，这真是个大挑战。

segments.en: How am I supposed to know?
All right, so that's basically a curveball.
segments.cn: 好吧，这基本上就是一个挑战。

segments.en: You can say an unexpected problem or situation.
segments.cn: 你可以说是一个意想不到的问题或情况。

segments.en: That's right.
And our last phrase, and we'll probably one that you already know, home run.
segments.cn: 我们最后一个短语，可能你已经知道了，满贯。

segments.en: A home run.
A home run.
From baseball, we know that that's when you hit the ball really far.
segments.cn: 在棒球中，我们知道这是当你把球打得很远。

segments.en: And you hit it outside of the playing area or outside the park.
segments.cn: 而且你把球打出了比赛区域或公园。

segments.en: Yes.
And now if you use it in a business context or in your daily life... It means something similar.
segments.cn: 现在如果你在商业环境或日常生活中使用它……意思是类似的。

segments.en: Why don't we take a listen to the examples and see if we can figure it out.
segments.cn: 我们为什么不听听这些例子，看看能否弄明白。

segments.en: Example one.
Great job on that sales presentation.
segments.cn: 你在那个销售演示上的表现很好。

segments.en: You really hit a home run.
Example two.
Our sales team hit a home run this month by doubling our revenue.
segments.cn: 我们的销售团队这个月打了个满贯，收入翻了一番。

segments.en: Okay, so basically a home run is a success.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以基本上满贯就是成功。

segments.en: A victory.
A victory.
Yeah, something a big accomplishment.
That's right.
So we've seen a lot of these great phrases.
segments.cn: 所以我们看到了很多这些很棒的短语。

segments.en: And as you can see, a lot of them from baseball are used in your daily life.
segments.cn: 正如你所看到的，很多来自棒球的短语在你的日常生活中被使用。

segments.en: And there are many, many more.
Okay, well, why don't we hear them again in the baseball context?
segments.cn: 好吧，我们为什么不再在棒球的背景下听听它们？

segments.en: And we'll listen to the dialogue one more time.
Hello, baseball fans, and welcome back to today's game.
segments.cn: 你好，棒球迷，欢迎回到今天的比赛。

segments.en: My name is Rick Fields and of course I am here once again with a man that seals the deal, Bob Copeland.
segments.cn: 我叫瑞克·菲尔兹，当然我再次和达成交易的鲍勃·科普兰在一起。

segments.en: It's a beautiful day to see two world-class teams face each other and fight for their right to be called champions.
segments.cn: 今天是个美丽的日子，看到两支世界级的球队对决，争夺冠军的称号。

segments.en: Well, the national anthem has just been sung and the umpire has started the game.
segments.cn: 好吧，国歌刚刚唱完，裁判开始了比赛。

segments.en: It's time to play ball.
Roger Vargas is up at bat.
segments.cn: 罗杰·瓦尔加斯上场打击。

segments.en: Pitcher winds up and strike one.
Very nice curveball by the pitcher.
The catcher gives him the sign.
He winds up.
And Vargas gets a line drive.
segments.cn: 瓦尔加斯击出了一记平飞球。

segments.en: The players are scrambling to get the ball.
Vargas gets to first base and he's still going.
segments.cn: 瓦尔加斯到达一垒，他还在继续前进。

segments.en: The outfielder throws it to second.
Vargas slides.
He's safe.
Great play.
We have a runner on third and up at bat is Brian Okami.
segments.cn: 我们在三垒有一个跑者，打击的是布莱恩·冈美。

segments.en: There's the pitch.
He hits it.
It's going, going.
That ball is gone.
Home run by Okami.
That puts this team ahead by two as we are at the bottom of the fifth inning here at Ritchie Stadium.
segments.cn: 这让这支球队领先两分，现在是第五局底部，在里奇体育场。

segments.en: All right, so an interesting dialogue, a very interesting sport.
segments.cn: 好吧，这是一个有趣的对话，非常有趣的运动。

segments.en: And well, personally, I never played this as a child.
segments.cn: 而且，个人来说，我小时候从来没有玩过这个。

segments.en: Me neither, really.
I don't really like it too much, but it is kind of fun to go to a game and especially in the United States, have those hot dogs and all that stuff.
segments.cn: 我不太喜欢，但去看比赛还是挺有趣的，尤其是在美国，吃热狗和那些东西。

segments.en: Yep.
Well, a cultural event, a really important piece of American culture.
segments.cn: 好吧，这是一个文化事件，是美国文化中非常重要的一部分。

segments.en: Exactly.
So, well, we encourage you to come to our website, EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 所以，我们鼓励你访问我们的网站，EnglishPod.com。

segments.en: Tell us what you think.
And also, of course, if you have questions or doubts, be sure to tell us.
segments.cn: 当然，如果你有任何问题或疑虑，一定要告诉我们。

segments.en: If you have any other sort of baseball related phrases, let us know about them on the website.
segments.cn: 如果你有其他与棒球相关的短语，请在网站上告诉我们。

segments.en: Okay, so we'll see you guys there.
Thanks for downloading and until next time, goodbye.
segments.cn: 感谢下载，直到下次，再见。
